quiz_one.question: Which of the following is NOT an object oriented programming language?
quiz_one.explanation: C is not an object oriented programming language. C does not have support for inheritance, which is a crucial feature of object oriented programming.

quiz_one.question: What is the number of primitive data types in Java?
quiz_one.explanation: Java has 8 primitive data types: byte, char, double, short, int, long, float and boolean.

quiz_one.question: What is the keyword used to declare constants in Javascript?
quiz_one.explanation: The correct keyword to use when declaring constants in Javascript is "const"

quiz_one.question: In Javascript, == checks for the equality in variable types and === checks for equality in variable values.
quiz_one.explanation: == is used to check equality in variable values, whereas === checks for equality in variable types.

quiz_one.question: Which of the following statements regarding an object is true?
quiz_one.correct_answer: An object is an instance of a class
choices: An object is an instance of a class
An object is a reference to an attribute
quiz_one.explanation: An object is considered as an instance of a class. The rest of the statements are false.

quiz_one.question: What is it called, when a class is extending an existing class?
quiz_one.explanation: Inheritance involves using the keyword "extends", which entails the extending of one class from a superclass.

quiz_one.question: The process of wrapping up data and functions into a single unit is called Polymorphism.
quiz_one.explanation: Wrapping up data and functions into a single unit is the process of Encapsulation.

quiz_one.question: Which of the following is used to find and resolve bugs in Java?
quiz_one.explanation: JDB, or Java Debugger is the command-line debugger that is used to resolve bugs in a Java class.

quiz_one.question: In Java, what is the keyword used to access features of a package?
quiz_one.explanation: The correct keyword to access a package is "import".

quiz_one.question: What does JAR stand for in the context of Java?
quiz_one.explanation: In Java, JAR stands for Java ARchive, which is a package file format used to put together all the metadata and resources into a single file.

quiz_one.question: In Python, which of following are NOT considered a core data type?
quiz_one.explanation: While a Dictionary, List and Tuple are considered a core data type, a Class is a user defined data type.

quiz_one.question: In Python, which of the following operators are used for floor division?
quiz_one.explanation: "//" is the correct operator for floor division.

quiz_one.question: Which of the following data structures prohibit repeated elements?
quiz_one.explanation: A set allows a user to store any number of unique values

quiz_one.question: Select the data structures that are considered as non-linear data structures.
quiz_one.explanation: Binary trees and graphs are considered as non-linear data structures.

quiz_one.question: What is the output of the code snippet below?
quiz_one.explanation: At position 1 of the string "Complete", the char is "o", and the char at position 7 is "e". By placing an "i" at position 1 and a "d" at position 7, you get a new string, "Cimpletd"

quiz_one.question: Which of the following is the correct way to initialize a List in Java?
quiz_one.explanation: When initializing a list in Java, it is important to indicate which primitive data type the list will utilize, give the list a name and finally don't forget to include the "new" keyword into the initialization.

quiz_one.question: In Java, what is the maximum size for the int data type?
quiz_one.explanation: Integers in Java are represented in 2's complement binary form and each integer gets 32 bits of space.

quiz_one.question: In Java, without any class instances, a non-static method can be called by a static method.
quiz_one.explanation: There must be a class instance within the static method in order to call a non-static method.

quiz_one.question: What would be cause for an ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception?
quiz_one.correct_answer: Accessing an array with an illegal index
choices: Referencing an array that doesn't exist
Adding additional indexes to an array
Accessing an array with an illegal index

quiz_one.question: Which of the following sorting algorithms have the worst time complexity in the worst case scenario?
quiz_one.explanation: Bubble Sort, of all the other choices, is the only sorting algorithm that has a time complexity of O(n^2) in the worst case scenario. The rest of the algorithms all are O(nlogn) in time.

quiz_two.question: What does API stand for?
quiz_two.explanation: API stands for Application Programming Interface, which is a method used to connect computers to computer programs.

quiz_two.question: How many ways can CSS styling be added into an HTML page?
quiz_two.explanation: There are 3 ways to add CSS to an HTML page: Inline CSS, using internal styling through the use of a <style> tag, or having an external CSS file

quiz_two.question: Considering the section of an HTML page below, what is the proper CSS styling to center the text?
quiz_two.explanation: The proper CSS class to manipulate text alignment is "text-align".

quiz_two.question: What is the correct tag to use when referencing a Javascript file in an HTML file?
quiz_two.explanation: The <script> tag is the correct tag to use when calling a Javascript file in an HTML file.

quiz_two.question: What is the correct HTML attribute to use when referencing a link?
quiz_two.explanation: Hypertext Reference, otherwise known as href, is used as an anchor tag attribute to create links to another page or to a specific section of the same page.

quiz_two.question: An HTTP 404 error indicates that the server the browser is communicating to cannot find what was being requested.
quiz_two.explanation: An HTTP 404 error indicates that the browser was able to communicate with a given server, but the server could not find what was requested.

quiz_two.question: An HTML page is read and rendered by what?
quiz_two.explanation: A web browser can be used to read and render HTML files, as they are web pages.

quiz_two.question: The heading tag is defined as <hx>, where x is a number that indicates that the heading size gets larger as the number gets larger.
quiz_two.explanation: The smaller the number next to "h" in the heading tag, the bigger the heading is. 1 is the smallest number it can go.

quiz_two.question: What is the name of the location address of hypertext documents?
quiz_two.explanation: Uniform Resource Locator is another name for the location address of hypertext documents.

quiz_two.question: Which tag is used to manipulate the display of the titvle bar of a web page?
quiz_two.explanation: The <title> tag is used to assign text to the title display of a web page, and the title tag belongs in the <head> tag.

quiz_two.question: What are the two aspects that make up a style tag?
quiz_two.explanation: To apply styling on an HTML webpage, a selector must be specified in the <style> tag and assign a value to a specific property within that selector.

quiz_two.question: What is the name of the communication protocol that is used to transfer hypertext documents?
quiz_two.explanation: The communication protocol that the Internet uses to transfer hypertext documents is called Hyper Text Transfer Protocol, or HTTP.

quiz_two.question: What is the name of the process where you transfer your HTML content from machine to server?
quiz_two.explanation: Hosting is the name of the process of transferring HTML code from a machine to a server.

quiz_two.question: What is the tag that is used to contain a collection of controls in an HTML page?
quiz_two.explanation: The <form> tag can contain a collection of controls, such as check boxes, input text fields, radio buttons and submit buttons.

quiz_two.question: Which of the following is NOT a CSS framework?
quiz_two.explanation: jQuery is a Javascript library that is designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling.

quiz_two.question: MongoDB, CouchDB and Microsoft SQL Server are examples of strictly NoSQL databases
quiz_two.explanation: Microsoft SQL Server is a relational database management system, that contains support for both SQL and NoSQL databases.

quiz_two.question: How is a function declared in Javascript?
quiz_two.explanation: "function" is the correct keyword to use when defining a function in Javascript.

quiz_two.question: What does JSON stand for?
quiz_two.explanation: JavaScript Object Notation is the proper term that is abbreviated to JSON.

quiz_two.question: What is the proper method of defining a key-value pairs in JSON objects?
quiz_two.explanation: The correct format to defining a key-value pair in a JSON Object is: "Name" : "Value"

quiz_two.question: Which of the following input types allow users to select only one of the options displayed?
quiz_two.explanation: Radio buttons can only have one option selected at a time.
